title: How to Ripen Mangoes
description:
Learn how to ripen mangoes with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Ripen-Mangoes

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to ripen mangoes wrap them in a brown paper bag and leave them overnight which will speed up the ripening process you can also add an apple or banana to the bag to make the mangoes ripen even faster if you don't have a brown paper bag try submerging the mangoes in a bowl of uncooked rice or popcorn kernels overnight which will also help them ripen simmer if you're not in a rush leave the mangoes out on a counter at room temperature and wait a few days for them to ripento ripen mangoes wrap them in a brown paper bag and leave them overnight which will speed up the ripening process you can also add an apple or banana to the bag to make the mangoes ripen even faster if you don't have a brown paper bag try submerging the mangoes in a bowl of uncooked rice or popcorn kernels overnight which will also help them ripen simmer if you're not in a rush leave the mangoes out on a counter at room temperature and wait a few days for them to ripen

title: How to Roast Cashews
description:
Learn How to Roast Cashews with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Roast-Cashews

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to roast cashews first pre-heat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit 175 degrees Celsius line a baking sheet with parchment paper then spread the cashews out evenly across the sheet and sprinkle 1 to 2 teaspoons of oil over them next stir the cashews and roast them in three to five-minute intervals stirring them each time to prevent sticking you'll know they're done when they give off a strong pleasant odor let them cool before servingto roast cashews first pre-heat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit 175 degrees Celsius line a baking sheet with parchment paper then spread the cashews out evenly across the sheet and sprinkle 1 to 2 teaspoons of oil over them next stir the cashews and roast them in three to five-minute intervals stirring them each time to prevent sticking you'll know they're done when they give off a strong pleasant odor let them cool before serving

title: How to Sauté
description:
Learn How to Sauté with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Sauté

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to saute vegetables fish or meat start by cutting the ingredients into uniform pieces use a skillet or saute pan with a wide flat bottom and short sides for better browning avoid using a nonstick pan if you can heat the pan over medium-high heat for several minutes if you're sauteing larger pieces of food like chicken or fish use medium heat instead next add a small amount of oil or butter so that it just covers the bottom of the pan the oil should simmer in the pan but not smoke place your ingredients in a single layer in the pan with enough space to move them around if your ingredients won't all fit in the pan at the same time work in batches let the ingredients cook in the pan shaking the pan or stirring them occasionally saute vegetables until they are just cooked through delicate vegetables like spinach can cook as quickly as a 1 to 2 minutes while stirring bowls like onions can take up to 10 minutes chicken breasts take about 5 minutes per side and fish fillets usually cook in about 3 to 4 minutes per side to tell when chicken or fish is done cooking use a digital thermometer to see what its internal temperature is chicken is safe to eat at 165 degrees Fahrenheit while fish should be at least 145 degrees Fahrenheit before you serve itto saute vegetables fish or meat start by cutting the ingredients into uniform pieces use a skillet or saute pan with a wide flat bottom and short sides for better browning avoid using a nonstick pan if you can heat the pan over medium-high heat for several minutes if you're sauteing larger pieces of food like chicken or fish use medium heat instead next add a small amount of oil or butter so that it just covers the bottom of the pan the oil should simmer in the pan but not smoke place your ingredients in a single layer in the pan with enough space to move them around if your ingredients won't all fit in the pan at the same time work in batches let the ingredients cook in the pan shaking the pan or stirring them occasionally saute vegetables until they are just cooked through delicate vegetables like spinach can cook as quickly as a 1 to 2 minutes while stirring bowls like onions can take up to 10 minutes chicken breasts take about 5 minutes per side and fish fillets usually cook in about 3 to 4 minutes per side to tell when chicken or fish is done cooking use a digital thermometer to see what its internal temperature is chicken is safe to eat at 165 degrees Fahrenheit while fish should be at least 145 degrees Fahrenheit before you serve it

title: How to Sauté Onions
description:
Learn how to sauté onions with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Saut%C3%A9-Onions

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: [Music] to saute onions start by removing the skin and chopping or dicing the onion as desired coat the bottom of a skillet with olive oil or butter then place the skillet over medium-high heat on your stovetop once the oil is hot and begins to shimmer add your onion pieces to the skillet use a spatula to keep the onions moving around in the skillet which will prevent burning and saute them for five to seven minutes you'll know the onions are done when they're soft translucent and lightly browned[Music] to saute onions start by removing the skin and chopping or dicing the onion as desired coat the bottom of a skillet with olive oil or butter then place the skillet over medium-high heat on your stovetop once the oil is hot and begins to shimmer add your onion pieces to the skillet use a spatula to keep the onions moving around in the skillet which will prevent burning and saute them for five to seven minutes you'll know the onions are done when they're soft translucent and lightly browned

description:

subtitles: to shred chicken cook the chicken first by boiling or frying so it's easier to shred then let the chicken cool completely once it's cool use your hands or fork to pull the chicken off the bone and shred it into small thin pieces you can also put the pieces of chicken in a mixer and mix them on a low speed until they're shredded when you're finished add the shredded chicken to your recipe or store it in an airtight container for later youto shred chicken cook the chicken first by boiling or frying so it's easier to shred then let the chicken cool completely once it's cool use your hands or fork to pull the chicken off the bone and shred it into small thin pieces you can also put the pieces of chicken in a mixer and mix them on a low speed until they're shredded when you're finished add the shredded chicken to your recipe or store it in an airtight container for later you

title: How to Shred Zucchini
description:
Learn how to shred zucchini with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Shred-Zucchini

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to shred zucchini easily with a food processor start by washing the zucchini with cool water you can also peel it if you don't like the taste of the skin then cut off the ends of the zucchini and slice it in half lengthwise if your zucchini is longer than 8 inches use a spoon to scoop out the seeds in the middle next chop the pieces into 2 inch squares and put the cubes into the processor pulse the zucchini for about 30 seconds to shred it remove the shredded zucchini from the processor and enjoyto shred zucchini easily with a food processor start by washing the zucchini with cool water you can also peel it if you don't like the taste of the skin then cut off the ends of the zucchini and slice it in half lengthwise if your zucchini is longer than 8 inches use a spoon to scoop out the seeds in the middle next chop the pieces into 2 inch squares and put the cubes into the processor pulse the zucchini for about 30 seconds to shred it remove the shredded zucchini from the processor and enjoy

title: Simmering vs. Boiling | Cooking Light
description: Knowing the difference between simmering and boiling can save a meal. Check out these indicators to differentiate between the two.
subtitles: knowing the difference between boiling and simmering seems easy but people tend to confuse the two and the difference can lead to a ruined dish simmering is when one or two bubbles break the surface every second a boil is a fury of bubbles if you were to boil a roast instead of simmering it it would lead to a tough rest since a boil doesn't soften the connective tissues like a simmer however if you were to simmer pasta instead of boiling it would lead to gummy pasta because boiling is necessary to agitate the pasta and heat it to completion for more great tips and cooking wisdom visit cooking light calm youknowing the difference between boiling and simmering seems easy but people tend to confuse the two and the difference can lead to a ruined dish simmering is when one or two bubbles break the surface every second a boil is a fury of bubbles if you were to boil a roast instead of simmering it it would lead to a tough rest since a boil doesn't soften the connective tissues like a simmer however if you were to simmer pasta instead of boiling it would lead to gummy pasta because boiling is necessary to agitate the pasta and heat it to completion for more great tips and cooking wisdom visit cooking light calm you

title: How to Slice a Cucumber
description:
Learn how to slice a cucumber with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Slice-a-Cucumber

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to slice a cucumber first scrub the cucumber clean under cool water if you want the slices to be skinless peel the cucumber then cut the stem ends off with a knife to cut discs slice the cucumber crosswise into one-half inch 1.25 centimeter slices to make half moons cut the cucumber in half lengthwise and slice each half into vertical one-half inch 1.25 centimeter slices to make square shapes you can trim the round sides of the cucumber off then use cross cuts to slice the rectangle into smaller rectangles or squares you can also cut the cucumber in half widthwise and cut the two halves vertically into long thin stripsto slice a cucumber first scrub the cucumber clean under cool water if you want the slices to be skinless peel the cucumber then cut the stem ends off with a knife to cut discs slice the cucumber crosswise into one-half inch 1.25 centimeter slices to make half moons cut the cucumber in half lengthwise and slice each half into vertical one-half inch 1.25 centimeter slices to make square shapes you can trim the round sides of the cucumber off then use cross cuts to slice the rectangle into smaller rectangles or squares you can also cut the cucumber in half widthwise and cut the two halves vertically into long thin strips

title: How to Soften Butter
description:
This quick video will show you the best ways to soften butter!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to soften butter quickly heat it in the microwave for five second intervals until it's soft enough you can also cut the butter up into small pieces before leaving it out to soften if you are in a rush but you don't have a microwave put the butter in a sealable plastic bag and then flatten it with a rolling pin until it's about a quarter-inch thick once you're done flattening the butter it should be softenedto soften butter quickly heat it in the microwave for five second intervals until it's soft enough you can also cut the butter up into small pieces before leaving it out to soften if you are in a rush but you don't have a microwave put the butter in a sealable plastic bag and then flatten it with a rolling pin until it's about a quarter-inch thick once you're done flattening the butter it should be softened

title: Quick Tips: How to Soften Hard Cookies
description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLALQuK1NDrj4G_X93bgPzTj8SZhEBcVD

-

Cookies gone hard? Put them in an airtight container with a piece of bread, or a damp paper towel wrapped in punctured aluminum foil. Presto!

Woman: Cookies gone hard?

Man: Quick Tips!

subtitles: if you need to make sour milk pour whole or two percent milk into a bowl then add fresh lemon juice or white vinegar to the bowl use a spoon to stir the acid and the milk together until they're fully blended let the mixture sit at room temperature for five to minutes which will give the milk time to thicken up and curdle slightly you can use this mixture to replace buttermilk in a recipe create marinades for meat or to make cottage cheese youif you need to make sour milk pour whole or two percent milk into a bowl then add fresh lemon juice or white vinegar to the bowl use a spoon to stir the acid and the milk together until they're fully blended let the mixture sit at room temperature for five to minutes which will give the milk time to thicken up and curdle slightly you can use this mixture to replace buttermilk in a recipe create marinades for meat or to make cottage cheese you
